question: What would happen if the condition in line 8 palindrome() is changed to if palindrome(word.strip(word[0])).

answers.text: Nothing. The function would work the same: the first and last letter would be removed.

tipsAndFeedback.chosenFeedback: The strip() function removes the same letter from the beginning and end of a string, including repeated letters.

answers.text: Some words, such as "madamm", would be incorrectly recognized as a palindrome.

tipsAndFeedback.chosenFeedback: The strip() function removes a given letter from the beginning and end of the string, including repeated letters. When strip('m') is used with "madamm", the resultant string is "ada".

detailedSolution: The strip() function removes a given letter from the beginning and end of the string, including repeated letters. When strip('m') is used with "madamm", the resultant string is "ada".
